children.text: Org-mode formatting maps to Lexical's text format bitmask:

children.html:
Format Org Syntax Bitmask
Bold *bold* 1
Italic /italic/ 2
Strikethrough +struck+ 4
Underline _underline_ 8
Code ==code== 16

children.heading: Table Org Source
children.content:
| Format        | Org Syntax      | Bitmask |
|---------------+-----------------+---------|
| Bold          | =*bold*=          |       1 |
| Italic        | =/italic/=        |       2 |

children.heading: Org Source
children.content:
Format text with *bold*, /italic/, +strikethrough+, _underline_, and =code=.

Combine them: */bold-italic/*, *_bold-underline_*, */+all three+/*.

children.text: Org headlines become Lexical headings. The post title is H1, so content starts at H2.

children.html:
Org Stars Lexical Tag Typical Use
* H2 Major sections
** H3 Subsections
*** H4 Deep structure
**** H5 Rarely needed
***** H6 Almost never

children.heading: Org Source
children.content:
* H2 - Major Section (one star)
** H3 - Subsection (two stars)
*** H4 - Sub-subsection (three stars)
**** H5 - Rarely needed (four stars)
***** H6 - Avoid this deep (five stars)

children.calloutText: Deep nesting (H5, H6) often signals your content structure needs rethinking. Flat is usually better.

children.text: Asides render as large, emphasized block quotes ‚Äî typically used for pull quotes or tangential information. Unlike callouts, asides have no color or emoji options.
Asides are minimal containers. They use Ghost's
class which renders larger than regular blockquotes with distinct styling.
This is a regular blockquote ‚Äî smaller, with a left border. Best for quoting other sources or adding brief commentary.

children.html:
Type Use Case Styling
Blockquote Quoting sources Border-left, italic
Aside Pull quotes, tangential info Large text, emphasized
Callout Tips, warnings, alerts Colored box + emoji

children.heading: Org Source
children.content:
#+BEGIN_ASIDE
Asides are minimal containers. They use Ghost's =kg-blockquote-alt= class which
renders larger than regular blockquotes with distinct styling.
#+END_ASIDE

#+BEGIN_QUOTE
This is a regular blockquote ‚Äî smaller, with a left border. Best for quoting
other sources or adding brief commentary.
#+END_QUOTE

children.text: Prominent sections to drive reader action. More customizable than simple buttons.

children.textValue: Minimal ‚Äî Simple and clean. Great for subtle prompts.
Immersive ‚Äî Bold and attention-grabbing. For important conversions.
Branded ‚Äî Shows site identity with accent colors.

children.html:
Property Values Description
:layout minimal, immersive, branded Visual style
:buttonText any string Button label
:url URL Button link
:backgroundColor grey, white, blue, etc. Background (9 colors)
:buttonColor hex (#000000) Button background
:buttonTextColor hex (#ffffff) Button text color
:alignment left, center Content alignment

children.text: Create your content using the patterns shown above.

children.code:
node validate-lexical.js output.json
# With HTML preview:
node validate-lexical.js output.json --html preview.html

cd /srv/ii.coop
node ghost.js post create "Post Title" output.json --format lexical

children.text: For video/audio/files, upload first then update the org with URLs:

children.code:
# Upload media file
node ghost.js upload /path/to/video.mp4

# Returns: https://coop.ghost.io/content/media/2026/01/video.mp4
# Add this URL to your :src attribute

;; In Emacs, with ghost-publish.el loaded:
M-x ghost-publish-enrich-buffer

Category Nodes
Text Paragraph, Heading (H2-H6), Line Break
Format Bold, Italic, Strikethrough, Underline, Code, Link
Structure Blockquote, Horizontal Rule, Table (as HTML)
Lists Ordered, Unordered, Nested, Checkbox
Code Code Block (syntax highlighted)

Media Image (3 widths), Video, Audio, Gallery, File, Embed

Product Product Card
